Unnamed: 5.1:
CIS
Security Configuration Benchmark For Apache Web Server 2.2
Version 3.1.0
June 11th, 2012
Unnamed: 5.5:
1.9.1 Denial of Service Mitigation (Level 1, Scorable) 
Add or modify the MaxKeepAliveRequests directive in the Apache configuration to have a value of 100 or more. p71
Unnamed: 5.8:
1.2.2 Enable the Log Config Module (Level 1, Scorable)
For dynamically loaded modules, add or modify the LoadModule directive so that it is present in the apache configuration as below and not commented out : LoadModule log_config_module modules/mod_log_config.so p12
Unnamed: 5.22:
1.7.1 Install mod_ssl and/or mod_nss (Level 1, Scorable)
Ensure the mod_ssl and/or mod_nss is loaded in the Apache configuration: # httpd -M | egrep 'ssl_module|nss_module' p59
Unnamed: 5.23:
1.7.4 Restrict weak SSL Protocols and Ciphers (Level 1, Scorable)
Add or modify the following line in the Apache server level configuration and every virtual host that is SSL enabled: SSLProtocol -ALL +SSLv3 +TLSv1 p65
Unnamed: 5.27:
1.8.1 Limit Information in the Server Token (Level 1, Scorable)
Add or modify the ServerTokens directive as shown below to have the value of Prod or ProductOnly: ServerTokens Prod page 68
Unnamed: 5.29:
1.5.4 Remove Default HTML Content (Level 1, Scorable)
Remove the Apache user manual content or comment out configurations referencing the manual # yum erase httpd-manual page 37
Unnamed: 5.30:
1.5.5 Remove Default CGI Content printenv (Level 1, Scorable)
Remove the printenv default CGI in cgi-bin directory if it is installed. # rm $APACHE_PREFIX/cgi-bin/printenv page 39
Unnamed: 5.31:
1.6.2 Configure the Access Log (Level 1, Scorable)
Add or modify the LogFormat directives in the Apache configuration to use the standard and recommended combined format show as shown below. LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-agent}i\"" combined
Unnamed: 5.32:
1.9.1 Denial of Service Mitigation (Level 1, Scorable)
Add or modify the Timeout directive in the Apache configuration to have a value of 10 seconds or shorter. Timeout 10 page 71
Unnamed: 5.33:
1.9.1 Denial of Service Mitigation (Level 1, Scorable)
Add or modify the KeepAlive directive in the Apache configuration to have a value of On, so that Keepalive connections are enabled. KeepAlive On page 71
Unnamed: 5.34:
1.9.1 Denial of Service Mitigation (Level 1, Scorable)
Add or modify the KeepAliveTimeout directive in the Apache configuration to have a value of 15 or less. KeepAliveTimeout 15 page 71
Unnamed: 5.35:
1.5.3 Minimize Options for Other Directories (Level 1, Scorable)
FollowSymLinks & SymLinksIfOwnerMatch – The following of symbolic links is not recommended and should be disabled if possible. Page 35
Unnamed: 5.36: 1.5.3 Minimize Options for Other Directories Includes & IncludesNOEXEC – The IncludesNOEXEC option should only be needed when server side includes are required. The full Includes option should not be used as it also allows execution of arbitrary shell commands. Page 35
Unnamed: 5.37: 1.5.3 Minimize Options for Other Directories Includes & IncludesNOEXEC – The IncludesNOEXEC option should only be needed when server side includes are required. The full Includes option should not be used as it also allows execution of arbitrary shell commands. Page 35
Unnamed: 5.38:
1.5.3 Minimize Options for Other Directories (Level 1, Scorable)
Multiviews – Is appropriate if content negotiation is required such as for multiple language are supported. Page 35
Unnamed: 5.39:
1.5.3 Minimize Options for Other Directories (Level 1, Scorable)
Indexes – The Indexes option causes automatic generation of indexes, if the default index page is missing, and should be disabled unless required. Page 35
Unnamed: 5.40:
1.9.2 Buffer Overflow Mitigation (Level 2, Scorable)
Add or modify the LimitRequestBody directive in the Apache configuration to have a value of 102400 (100K) or less. Please read the Apache documentation so that it is understood that this directive will limit the size of file up-loads to the web server. LimitRequestBody 102400 page 73
Unnamed: 5.41:
1.9.2 Buffer Overflow Mitigation (Level 2, Scorable)
Add or modify the LimitRequestFields directive in the Apache configuration to have a value of 100 or less. If the directive is not present the default depends on a compile time configuration, but defaults to a value of 100. LimitRequestFields 100 page 73
Unnamed: 5.42:
1.9.2 Buffer Overflow Mitigation (Level 2, Scorable)
Add or modify the LimitRequestFieldsize directive in the Apache configuration to have a value of 1024 or less. LimitRequestFieldsize 1024 page 73
Unnamed: 5.43:
1.9.2 Buffer Overflow Mitigation (Level 2, Scorable)
Add or modify the LimitRequestline directive in the Apache configuration to have a value of 512 or shorter. LimitRequestline 512 page 72
Unnamed: 5.44:
1.6.1 Configure the Error Log (Level 1, Scorable)
Add an ErrorLog directive if not already configured. The file path may be relative or absolute, or the logs may be configured to be sent to a syslog server. ErrorLog "logs/error_log" Add a similar ErrorLog directive for each virtual host configured if the virtual host will have different people responsible for the web site. Each responsible individual or organization needs access to their own web logs, and needs the skills/training/tools for monitor the logs. page 50
Unnamed: 5.45:
1.6.2 Configure the Access Log (Level 1, Scorable)
Add or modify the CustomLog directives in the Apache configuration to use the combined format with an appropriate log file, syslog facility or piped logging utility. CustomLog log/access_log combined
Add a similar CustomLog directives for each virtual host configured if the virtual host will have different people responsible for the web site. Each responsible individual or organization needs access to their own web logs, and needs the skills/training/tools for monitor the logs. page 51
Unnamed: 5.46:
1.6.1 Configure the Error Log (Level 1, Scorable)
Add or modify the LogLevel in the apache configuration to have a value of notice or lower. Note that is it is compliant to have a value of info or debug if there is a need for a more verbose log and the storage and monitoring processes are capable of handling the extra load. 1.9.3 Restrict Listen Directive (Level 2, Scorable)
The Apache Listen directive specifies the IP addresses and port numbers the Apache web server will listen for requests. Rather than be unrestricted to listen on all IP addresses available to the system, the specific IP address or addresses intended should be explicitly specified. Specifically a Listen directive with no IP address specified, or with an IP address of zeros should not be used.  Page 74
